title: Grayscale’s Bitcoin spot ETF sees outflows of over $2 billion in five trading days
description: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust sees over $2 billion in outflows in less than a week while rival ETF providers report growth.

title: Franklin Templeton Eyes Broad Crypto Expansion Beyond Bitcoin, Foresees More ETP Filings
description: Franklin Templeton’s Head of Digital Assets, Sandy Kaul, foresees an increase in filings following the recent approval of 11 new spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds. title: Crypto Industry reacts to EU’s new AML rules
description: The European Union recently reached a milestone by finalizing a comprehensive anti-money laundering regulatory framework, sparking concerns within the crypto industry. The new rules, seen by some as more stringent than those applied to traditional financial institutions, encompass strict customer verification requirements and measures to mitigate risks in transactions involving self-hosted wallets and cross-border transfers. title: Radworks sees 41% gains in spite of stagnant market
description: Radworks takes the second spot on CoinGecko's top gainers report with a 41.5% price surge in the last 24 hours, pushing the token to $2.60.

title: Former LedgerPrime employees launch new digital asset hedge fund
description: Former LedgerPrime personnel have initiated Split Capital, a hedge fund focusing on long-term investments in liquid digital tokens.

title: Binance Soars: Records $4.6 Billion Inflows Post $4.3 Billion Settlement
description: Despite its regulatory hurdles, Binance recorded more inflows than expected. The exchange is rebuilding trust through a series of new tokens and product listings. title: Ripple News: BlackRock Confirms No Plans for XRP ETF, Citing Regulatory Uncertainty
description: BlackRock officially confirms it has no plans to launch a spot XRP ETF amid regulatory uncertainty and SEC battle. title: Investors Pull $579 Million from Grayscale Bitcoin ETF to Take Profits – Does This Prevent BTC Price from Finally Rising and Showing a ‘God Candle’ to $80,000?
description: Bitcoin’s stagnation is linked to outflows from Grayscale’s Bitcoin ETF, creating selling pressure and preventing a significant price increase. Grayscale’s outflows are due to higher expenses and competition from cheaper Bitcoin investment products, impacting the overall market sentiment.
